alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 21 at 9:18AM CDT until March 24 at 9:25PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Sulphur River Near Talco affecting Morris, Titus, Franklin and Red River Counties. For the Sulphur River...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sulphur River Near Talco. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of the heavily wooded floodplain. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the river bottoms should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 2.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Wednesday morning to a crest of 21.5 feet Wednesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 930 AM CDT.
